Dialogue: So you want me to tell you the story of my life...

Dialogue: That's what I do. I interview people. I collect lives. F.M. radio. F.F.R.C. I just interviewed a genuine hero, a cop who -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You'd have to have a lot of tape for my story. I've had a very unusual life.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: So much the better. I've got a pocket full of tapes.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You followed me here, didn't you?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Saw you in the street outside. You seemed interesting. Is this where you live?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It's just a room...

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: So shall we begin?  What do you do?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I'm a vampire.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: See? I knew you were interesting. You mean this literally, I take it?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Absolutely. I was watching you watching me. I was waiting for you in that alleyway. And then you began to speak.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Well, what a lucky break for me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Perhaps lucky for both of us.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I'll tell you my story. All of it. I'd like to do that very much.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You were going to kill me? Drink my blood?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes but you needn't worry about that now. Things change.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You believe this, don't you? That you're a vampire? You really think...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We can't begin this way. Let me turn on the light.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: But I thought vampires didn't like the light.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We love it. I only wanted to prepare you.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Good God!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Don't be frightened. I want this opportunity.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: How did you do that?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The same way you do it. A series of simple gestures. Only I moved too fast for you to see. I'm flesh and blood, you see. But not human. I haven't been human for two hundred years.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What can I do to put you at ease? Shall we begin like David Copperfield? I am born, I grow up. Or shall we begin when I was born to darkness, as I call it. That's really where we should start, don't you think?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You're not lying to me, are you?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Why should I lie? 1791 was the year it happened. I was twenty-four - younger than you are now.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But times were different then. I was a man at that age. The master of a large plantation just south of New Orleans...

Speaker: dissolve
Dialogue: TO:

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You're calling me a cheat?

Speaker: gambler
Dialogue: I'm calling you a piece of shit -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then do me a favor. Get rid of this piece of shit...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You lack the courage of your convictions, sir. Do it.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My invitation was open to anyone. Sailors, thieves, whores and slaves...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: They would have killed you -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then my luck would have changed.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You want death? Is it death you want?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You still want death? Or have you tasted it enough?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Enough...

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: That's how it happened?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No. The Gift of Darkness requires more than that, as you'll see.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Who the hell are you? What are you doing in my house?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: And a beautiful house it is too. Yours is a good life, isn't it?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You're not afraid of anything, are you?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Why should I be?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Are you going to put that through me too? Ruin my beautiful clothes?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Were all last night's promises for nothing?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What do you want from me?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I've come to answer your prayers. You want to die, don't you? Life has no meaning anymore, does it?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The wine has no taste. The food sickens you. There seems no reason for any of it, does there? But what if I could give it back to you? Pluck out the pain and give you another life? And it would be for all time? And sickness and death could never touch you again?

Speaker: dissolve
Dialogue: TO:

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Vampires, that's what we are. Creatures of darkness, only we see it that darkness more clearly than any mortal has ever seen...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Wouldn't it be sweet to bid pain goodbye? To wave away anguish and grief? To embrace the peace of the unending night?

Speaker: marble child
Dialogue: Papa...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Diane!!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: They are gone, Louis. Death took them. Death which you can now destroy...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You have to ask me for this. You have to want it, do you hear me?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Give it to me!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Vampires. We thrive on blood.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I want it!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Tomorrow night. You must prove yourself. I will give you the choice I never had.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The sun's coming up. Watch it carefully. If you come with me tomorrow, you'll never see it again.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Your grief has unhinged you. You've let your estate rot.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You let your overseer run riot, work your slaves to the bone. We'll start with him.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: How do you mean, start?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Call him.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Carlos!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Why the bloody whip, Carlos?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Let's call that a start.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I can't do it.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You've just done it -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Kill me if you will, but I can't do this...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Sitting collected at the head of the steps.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Don't worry. He was white trash, they come at two a penny. I dumped him in the swamp and untied the slave, licked his wounds clean.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You're the devil, aren't you? That's who you are.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I wish I were. But if I were, what would I want with you?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I can't go through with it, I tell you.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Your perfect. Your bitter and you're strong.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But why do you want me?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Because you're as strong as I was when I was alive.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You really want to be with them?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes. Kill me. Kill me like you promised -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You asked for death. I didn't promise it -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: It's not your wife and child my friend. It's death. Just that simple. Think and choose. It happens to everyone. Except us.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: We shall be this way always, my friend. Young as we are now. I'm lonely for a companion, lonely for your strength. But I'm not that lonely. Do you want to come or not?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Did I hear a yes?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: louis' pov
Dialogue: The moon, through hanging vines. The marble statue of his wife and child smile at him, as if come alive. Her hair blows in the breeze, wonderful gold tresses, the child's fingers reach out...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I've drained you to the point of death. If you drink from me you live for ever. If I leave you here you die.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No. Don't leave me here. Give it to me.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You're sure?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Sure...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Stop staring at my buttons. Didn't I tell you it was going to be fun?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You're body's dying. Pay no attention. It will take twenty minutes at most.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Dying?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: It happens to us all.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Come, you're going to feed now.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I want a woman.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: That doesn't matter anymore, Louis. You'll see. Come...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: They're all beautiful now. Men, women, the old, the young...simply because they are alive. -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Take him.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The crucifix -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Forget the crucifix. Take him.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Resist no more Louis. Feed...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What have I done?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You have fed. You were made for this...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Dear God, what have I done?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You've killed Louis. And enjoyed it.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Dear God, what have I become????

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You said the slave had a crucifix...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Oh, that rumor about crosses?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You can't look at them...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Nonsense, my friend. I can look on anything I like. And I am particularly fond of looking on crucifixes.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: The story about stakes through the heart?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The same. As you would say today... Bull shit.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: What about coffins?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Coffins... coffins unfortunately are a necessity...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes, that's you, my handsome friend. And you'll look that way till the stars fall from heaven.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It can't be...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Give it time. You're like a man who loses a limb and still imagines he feels pain. It will pass. And we must sleep now. I can feel the sun approaching.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You must get into it. It's the only safe place for you when the light comes.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And if I don't?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The sun will destroy the blood I've given you. Every tissue, every vein. The fire in this lantern could do that too.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Don't be afraid. In moments you'll be sleeping as soundly as you ever slept. And when you awake I'll be waiting for you, and so will all the world.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You told me something earlier. You said you didn't have a choice. Was that true?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Someday I'll tell you. We have a lot of time to talk to each other. You might say... we have all the time we shall ever need.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Dear God, what have I done?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Your wealth, dear Louis, is inestimable. Your income from cotton alone will keep us in comfort for a century.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You'll get used to killing. Just forget about that mortal coil. You'll become accustomed to things all too quickly.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Do you think so?

Speaker: yvette
Dialogue: You are not hungry, sir...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Au contraire, my dear. He could eat a horse...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I will finish it, Yvette. Now leave us.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Can't you pretend, you fool? Don't give the game away. We're lucky to have such a home.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Pretend to drink, at least.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Such fine crystal shouldn't go to waste...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I know. It gets cold so fast.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We can live like this? Off the blood of animals?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I wouldn't call it living. I'd call it surviving. A useful trick if you're caught for a month on a ship at sea.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: There's nothing in the world now that doesn't hold some...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Fascination...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes. And I'm bored with this prattle -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But we can live without taking human life. It's possible.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Anything is possible. But just try it for a week. Come into New Orleans and let me show you some real sport!

Speaker: teresa
Dialogue: Come on, mon cher. The best in the colony. Once you touch this you'll never go to any other tavern again.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You think so, cherie? But what if I'd rather taste your lips?

Speaker: teresa
Dialogue: My lips are even sweeter still...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Let's get out of here!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Have you ever been caught?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Of course not. It's so easy you almost feel sorry for them.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The trick is not to think about it. See that one? The widow St. Clair? she had that gorgeous young fop murder her husband. She's perfect for you. Go ahead.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But how do you know?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Read her thoughts.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I can't.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The dark gift is different for each of us. But one thing is true of everyone. We grow stronger as we go along.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Take my word for it. She blamed a slave for his murder. And do you know what they did to him?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: The evildoers are easier. And they taste better...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You whining coward of a vampire who prowls the night killing rats and poodles. You could have finished us both!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What have you done to me? You've condemned me to hell.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I don't know any hell -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You want to see me kill? Watch me kill you then -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What strength, my friend, what strength. I remember why I chose you now.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: But you can't kill me, Louis. Nor I you.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Feed on what you want, mon cherie. Rats, chickens, doves, goats. I'll leave you to it and watch you come round. Just remember, life without me would be even more unbearable...

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Yes... please...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Consider yourself lucky. In Paris a vampire has to be clever for many reasons. Here all one needs is a pair of fangs.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Paris? You came from Paris?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: As did the one who made me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Tell me about him. You must have learnt something from him! It had to happen for you as it did for me!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I learnt absolutely nothing. I wasn't give a choice, remember?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But you must know something about the meaning of it all, you must know where we come from, why we...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Why? Why should I know these things? Do you know them?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: That noise! It's driving me mad! We've been in the country for weeks, with nothing but that noise!!!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: They know about us. They see us dine on empty plates and drink from empty glasses.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Come the New Orleans then. There's an opera on tonight. A real french opera! We can dine in splendor!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I respect life, don't you see? For each and every human life I have respect.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Respect me a little then. I'm the only life you know.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You'll soon run out of chickens, Louis...

Speaker: yvette
Dialogue: Michi Louis? You don't want any supper?

Dialogue: No, ma cher. I need no supper. Is all well at Pointe Du Lac tonight?

Dialogue: We worry about you master. When do you ride about the fields? How long since you've been to the slave quarters? Everywhere there is death. Animals, men. Are you our master still at all?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Leave me alone now, Yvette.

Speaker: yvette
Dialogue: I will not go unless you listen to me. Send away this new friend of yours. The slaves are frightened of him. They are frightened of you.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I am frightened of myself, Yvette.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Hush, Yvette -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: This place is cursed. Damned, do you hear me? And your master is the devil.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Get out while you can. You're free men.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Unlike me, you are no free men...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Do I have to convince you?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You fool, what have you done?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What you wouldn't do. It's almost sunrise. It will be the sun or the fire. You said they can kill me. The sun or the fire!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Where are we?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Where do you think, my idiot friend? We're in a nice filthy cemetery. Does this make you happy? Is this fitting and proper enough?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We belong in hell.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: And what if there is no hell, or they don't want us there? Ever think of that?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You loved Yvette...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Can a vampire feel love?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You loved your wife, surely.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I was human then. Might as well ask can an angel feel love. Both are blesses or cursed with a certain... detachment. Though whether angels take as long to learn it as I, I will never know.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes, I loved Yvette. As I loved Pointe Du Lac. And as with each thing I loved, I destroyed it.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Not always...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Your friend has no head for wine.

Speaker: whore
Dialogue: She's stupid. I can warm that cold skin of yours better than she can.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Do you think so?

Speaker: whore
Dialogue: Why you're warm now.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Ah, but the price is pretty high. Your sweet friend - I exhausted her.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I'm leaving you. I can't stand this any longer.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What, no flowery speeches? About what a monster I am? What a vulgar fiend?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I'm not interested in you. You disgust me. I'm interested in my own nature and know I can't trust you to tell me the truth about me.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What do you imagine you are Louis?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I don't pretend to know.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Don't you understand, Louis, that you alone of all creatures can see death with impunity... you alone under the rising moon can strike like the hand of God.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Lestat, she's alive!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Vampires are killers. Predators, who's all seeing eyes were meant to give them detachment.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The girl, Lestat -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I know. Let her alone.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You think you can be human. You think you can go back. But you can't. You live off the blood of rats now Louis. How human is that?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Lie still, love...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You're tired love, you want to sleep.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Why do you do this Lestat?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I like to do it. I enjoy it. Take you aesthete's taste to purer things. Kill them swiftly if you will, but do it! For now doubt, you are a killer Louis. Ah!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: It's a coffin, a coffin! Get me out!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Of course it's a coffin. You're dead, love.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Lestat - finish this -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You finish her - if you feel so much -

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: You won't let me die, will you? You'll save me?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: But it's too late, love. Look at your wrist, you breast.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Unless I make her one of us...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: NO!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: THEN YOU KILL HER!!!!!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My God... to think you... are all I have to learn from...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: In the old world, they called it the dark gift, Louis. And I gave it to you.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Don't go that way Monsieur. It's the plague. Go back the way you came.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The way I came...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Mama, please wake up. Mama, I'm frightened, please wake up.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Monsieur, please help us. Papa's waiting for us at the ship. Please wake mama, Monsieur.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Ah, my philosopher, my martyr. "Never take a human life". Well you must admit it is funny. Or is it merely touching? I'm not sure.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Let's make some party of it, shall we? Maybe there's some life in the old lady yet?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Come back, Louis, you are what you are. The plague would have got her within hours anyway. Merciful Death how you love your precious guilt.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: All I need to find you Louis is follow the corpses of rats.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Pain is terrible for you. You feel it like no other creature because you are a vampire. You don't want it to go on.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Do what it is in your nature to do. And you will feel as you felt with that child in your arms.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Oh God Lestat. I felt peace. I felt an end to the craving.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: That and more.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Evil is a point of view. God kills, indiscriminately, and so shall we. For no creatures under God are as we are, none so like him as ourselves.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Is God merciless? Greedy and cruel?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Ah, but we have even more in common with our creator. come, I am like a mother tonight. I want a child.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: She's here, your wounded one.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What are you saying?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You need company, Louis. More congenial than mine...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Lestat!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You remember how you wanted her, the taste of her -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I didn't want to kill her.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Don't worry, Louis, you're conscience is clear. You left her alive.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Claudia, Claudia, listen to me. You're ill, my precious and I'm going to give you what you need to get well.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Lestat, what do you mean?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: That's it dear. More. You must drink it to get well.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Stop, that's enough. No more.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I want more.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What have you done?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: More.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes, cherie, of course you want more. And I'll show you how to get it. You drink from morals, my beauty, but from me? Never again.

Speaker: maid
Dialogue: Ah, quelle Belle enfant!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Gently, cherie. They are so innocent. They must not be made to suffer.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You are the devil! You are the instrument of Satan!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: That's enough, cherie. Stop before the heart stops.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I want some more.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: It's bet in the beginning, lest the death takes you down with it. yes, that's it. My child. My beloved child.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Where is Mamma?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Mamma's gone to Heaven, cherie, like that sweet lady over there. They all go to Heaven. And you did very well, cherie. Not a drop spilt. Very good! You're going to be our child now.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Your mama's left you with us. She wants you to be happy.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You are the devil! You are the instrument of Satan!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Shhhh! Do you want to frighten our little daughter?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I'm not your daughter.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes you are, my dearest. You are mine and Louis' daughter. You see Louis was going to leave us. He was going to go away. But now he's not. He's going to stay and make you happy.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Lou...eee...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You fiend. You monster.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: One happy family.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: A child vampire!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Shall we go on?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: He did it to make you stay with him!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Perhaps. He knew me. He knew I would love her more than the waking world. But there was more to it than that. Perhaps in the end he did it - to show me that he could. For he lavished affection on her, there was no doubt about that. Life was very different with madame Claudia, as you can imagine...

Speaker: dressmaker
Dialogue: Monsieur, I need more light. I shall go slind if you do not bring me a lamp, or let me fit this child during the day. Ouch!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Let me kiss it better...

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Claudia, Claudia, will you never learn? Who will we get now to finish your dress? A little practicality, cherie...

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Why are you crying, child?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Are you lost, my love?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Mama...

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Hush now, don't cry, We'll find her...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Mama...

Speaker: dollmaker
Dialogue: They are expensive, my dear. Maybe too expensive for a young girl like you...

Dialogue: Where his coffin sits. She slides the lid off, and curls in beside him.

Dialogue: Claudia, Claudia! Didn't I tell you, never in the house!

Dialogue: September 21st, one hour after sunset. The sky is still violet, the way Louis loves and as always Lestat was gone when we rose.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: How did you learn to write, Claudia?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: The way I learn everything. By watching you.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But you never let me see you kill, Louis.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Lestat taught you all you need to know about that.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Infant death, he calls me. Sweet daughter death. You know what he calls you? Merciful death.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He jests.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Why does he call you that?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Hush, Claudia don't talk about such things. Show me your book.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia! You did that?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Sit still. It's not finished -

Speaker: youth
Dialogue: You want to come inside, lovely?

Speaker: youth
Dialogue: Ever been kissed?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: She's like me, Louis. Small and yet not small at all. Like me.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Another doll? I have ten, you realize.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Well, I thought you could use another.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Why always on this night?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What night? What do you mean?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You always give me the doll on the same night of the year.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: I didn't realize.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Is this my birthday?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Some of these are so old and tattered. You should throw them away.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I have. Or there would be twice as many.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: But you're the fairest by far.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You dress me like a doll. You make my hair like a doll. Why?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You want me to be a doll forever?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia - don't -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Can't I change, like everybody else?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Which of you did it? Which of you made me the way I am?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What you are? You would be something other than you are?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: And if I cut my hair again?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: It will grow back again!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But it wasn't always so! I had a mother once! And Louis - he had a wife! He was mortal the same as she! And so was I!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You made us what we are, didn't you?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Stop her Louis!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: DID YOU DO IT TO ME????

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: How did you do it?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: And why should I tell you? It's in my power.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Why yours alone? Tell me how it was done!!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Be glad I made you what you are! You'd be dead not if I hadn't.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We're immortal. You've always known that.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Tell me why... you've got to tell me...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You see the old woman? That will never happen to you. You'll never grow old. You will never die.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: And it means something else too, doesn't it? I shall never, ever grow up.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I hate him. But I cannot bear to lose you. You're the only companion I have, forever. You taught me everything I know. Please tell me Louis. Tell me how it came to be that I am this... thing...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Come... I've something to show you...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I heard you crying. You were there in a room with your mother. You were hugging her for warmth, crying pitifully as you had been for days. Because your mother was dead...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I opened the shutters... I came into the room... I felt pity for you. Pity, but something else.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You... fed on me?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And he found me with you. I ran, sickened at what I'd done. Then he cut his wrist and fed you from him. I tried to stop him, but you were a vampire then. And have been every night hereafter.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You both did it?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I took your life. He gave you another one.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: And here it is. And I hate you both.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: But why did you tell her?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: How could I not? She had to know.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: And did you lose her? Did she go?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Where would she have gone? She was a child, and beautiful, heartbreaking merciless child. And I had made her that...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I walked all night. I walked as I walked years before when my mind swam with guilt at the thought of killing. I found myself at the Cathedral.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I thought of all the things I had done and couldn't undo. And I longed for one second's peace...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I had no fear. If anything I longed for something to happen, for the stones to tremble as I entered the foyer.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I almost genuflected from old habit. I almost prayed.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And then it struck me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What if the statues gave an image to nothing? What if I was the supernatural in this cathedral? The only immortal under this roof. And I felt nothing but loneliness. Loneliness to the point of madness.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You wish to go to confession? I was about to lock up the church.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: You are troubled, aren't you? Can I help?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It's too late, too late -

Speaker: preist
Dialogue: No, it's never too late. Come...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Bless me father for I have sinned so often and so long, I don't know how to change nor beg for forgiveness.

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Son, God is infinite in his capacity to forgive. Tell him from your heart.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Murders, father, death after death. The woman who died two nights ago in Jackson Square, I killed her. And thousands of others before her. I have walked the streets of New Orleans like the Grim reaper. And fed on human life for my own. I am a vampire, father, and have turned the one I love most of all into on too -

Speaker: priest
Dialogue: Do you know the meaning of sacrilege?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then there is no mercy.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You talk of sacrilege. Why if God exists does he suffer me to exist?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Why does he suffer me to live?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Locked together in hatred -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But I can't hate you Louis.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Is this the aroma of a mortal child?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Louis. Lover.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I was mortal to you. You gave me your immortal kiss. You became my mother and my father. And so I'm yours. Forever.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But now's the time to end it, Louis. Now's the time to leave him.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He'll never let us go.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Oh... really?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What is it now? You irritate me! Your very presence irritates me!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Does it?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Yes. And I'll tell you something else! I've met someone who will make a better vampire than both of you.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Is that supposed to frighten me?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: You're spoilt because you're an only child. You need a brother. Or I do. I'm weary of you both.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I suppose we could people the world with vampires, the three of us.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Not you my dear.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You're a liar. But you upset my plans.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: What plans?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I came to make peace with you, even if you're the father of lies. I want things to be as they were.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Stop pestering me then!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Oh, Lestat. I must do more than that. I've brought a present for you.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Then I hope its a beautiful woman with endowments you will never possess.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Better than that.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You haven't fed enough. I can tell by your color.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Oh, Claudia, you've outdone yourself. Where did you find them?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Drunk on brandy wine. A thimbleful. I thought of you when I saw them.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: We forgive each other then?

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Absinthe? You gave them absinthe?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: No. Laudanum.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Laudanum!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Yes. It killed them, unfortunately. But it keeps the blood warm.

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Ah Louis, Louis, she killed them... and let me drink...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Don't Louis -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Louis, put me in my coffin...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I'll put you in your coffin. Forever.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia! Don't do this thing!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Louis, Louis, I gave you the gift - help me -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What have you done, Claudia -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Louis! Look what's happening to him!!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Lestat. Oh, God forgive us.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Don't mock me, Louis. Help me.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Goodnight, sweet prince, may flights of devils wing you to your rest.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He's dead, Claudia, dead.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: The one good lesson he taught me, Louis. Never drink from the dead.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Help me. We must get rid of him.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Should we burn him? Bury him? What would he have liked, Louis?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Don't mock, Claudia...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: The swamp...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: In Europe, Louis. We shall meet our own kind. Find the one who made him. Learn what it means.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And suppose the one who made him knows nothing and the vampire who made him knows nothing, and it goes back, nothing proceeding from nothing, until there is nothing! And we must live with the knowledge that there is no knowledge.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And if we find the one who made him? Do we tell him we destroyed his own creation? The vampire Lestat?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: He belongs with those reptiles, Louis. He deserved to die.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then maybe so do we. Every night of our lives. He was my brother. My maker. He gave me this life, whatever it is.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I did it for us, Louis. So we could be free.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Louis, look at me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I can't. Go away from me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia - You're crying -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You never talked to me like that - in all these years.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And you never cried -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I can't bear it when you do - I would die rather than lose you Louis. I would die the way he died.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Hush, Claudia, hush now my dear -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Tell me you don't hate me Louis. I did it for you -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I love you Claudia. Always. And we are free now, Claudia. No Lestat. Just the two of us, beginning the great adventure of our lives.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The birds. We forgot about the birds. There's nothing for it but to let them go.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The workmen must have a trunk - don't stop, cherie -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Louis!!!

Speaker: the stairway
Dialogue: Louis walking to the door. The knocking gets louder.

Speaker: the parlour
Dialogue: Claudia runs for the stairs, after Louis.

Speaker: the hallway
Dialogue: Louis reaches the door. The knocking gets louder. He opens the door as -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Don't Louis -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: WHERE IS SHE? WHERE IS THAT ACCURSED CHILD?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It can't be -

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: It is! Take the back stairwell -

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: GIVE ME HER LOUIS!!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Stay back - for the love of God... or I'll burn you alive...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: The ship is sailing without us!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Not yet. Holding her tightly, Louis runs.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: Did he die in the fire?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He was dead to us. We were free. That was all that mattered.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Louis, your quest is for darkness only. This sea is not your sea. They myths of men are not your myths. Their history isn't yours.

Speaker: the acropolis
Dialogue: In the moonlight.  LOUIS  We saw the Acropolis by moonlight, shades of grey and silver. And I longed for the brilliant white of those marbles in the hot sun of Homer...  The sketch changes to a sketch of -

Speaker: transylvania
Dialogue: And the traditional shapes of the vampire landscape.  LOUIS  We docked at Varna and searched the rural countryside of the Carpathians, for what she liked to term "our kind"...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: The quest for these Old World vampires filled me with bitterness. We searched village after village, ruin after ruin and I was glad when always we found nothing. For what could the damned really have to say to the damned?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: You found nothing?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Peasant rumors, superstitions about garlic, crosses, stakes in the hear, all that - how do you say again? Bull shit. But one of our kind? Not a whisper.

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: No vampires in Transylvania? No Count Dracula?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Fictions, my friend. The vulgar fictions of a demented Irishman... So we repaired to Paris...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We were alive again. We were in love and so euphoric was I that I yielded to her every desire...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Help me, mon chere...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: How do I look?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Still my beautiful child.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: A beautiful child! Is that what you still think I am?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Why do you turn away? Why don't you look.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You want me to be your daughter forever, don't you?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Well tell me, papa. What was it like making love?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You don't remember? Or you never knew.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It was something hurries...and seldom savored... something acute that was quickly lost. It was the pale shadow of killing.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But how will I ever know, Louis?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I'll never find them, will I? My own kind...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Have I anything in common with her, Louis?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Or her, or her - or any of them?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia, you torture yourself.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: They are ducklings, that will grow into swans. Whereas I must be the duckling forever.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You are more beautiful than any of them.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: All her dolls resemble me.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Are they my kind Louis? Dolls never change either.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You are neither, Claudia. Now stop this -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You know her?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Yes. Should I take her, Louis? Among her dolls? make a doll of her in turn?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Come, Claudia...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You mean me harm?

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: You mean me harm?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Trickster. Buffoon!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I've searched the world for an immortal and this is what I find?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: He looks like an angel.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: You are all right.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Bring the petit beauty with you. No one will harm you. I won't allow it. Remember my name. Armand.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Remember what I've told you. They'll have different powers. They'll read your thoughts if you allow it.

Speaker: huge posters
Dialogue: Reading -  "THEATRE DES VAMPIRES PRESENTS THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH By Edgar Allen Poe"  The posters are illustrated with cliched images of vampires overcoming damsels in distress.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But this can't be real. This is nonsense.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Nonsense all right. But something tell me it's going to be the strangest nonsense we've ever seen.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Mortals, mortals everywhere. And lots of drops to drink.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: They are here. I know they are. Listen for something that doesn't make a sound.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It's a vampire. It's the one I saw in Rue St Jacques.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: They use no paint. And the audience think it is paint.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: How devilishly clever.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: She's no vampire.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No. She's frightened. She doesn't know where she is.

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: I don't want to die!

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: We are death!

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: Someone help me. Please... What have I done?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: This is no performance.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: And no one knows but us...

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: We all die. Death is the one thing you share with all those here.

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: Rapt faces.

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: But I'm young...

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: Death is no respecter of age. He can come any time, any place. Need I tell you what fate has in store for you?

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: I would take my chance. Let me go! Please...

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: And if you take that chance and live, what is your fate? The humpbacked toothless visage of old age?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: This is monstrous!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Yes, and very beautiful.

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: Just as this flesh is pink now, it will turn grey and wrinkle with age.

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: Let me live, please. I don't care.

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: Then why should you care if you die now?

Speaker: audience
Dialogue: Is awestruck by her beauty, her suffering.

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: And suppose death had a heart to love and to release you? To whom would he turn his passion? Would you pick a person from the crowd there? A person to suffer as you suffer?

Speaker: young girl
Dialogue: Oh, yes, take me Monsieur Vampire! I adore you!

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: You wait your turn.

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: Well, have you a sister, a mother, a daughter you would send in your place?

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: We alone can give death meaning. Do you know what it means to be loved by death, to become our bride?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: No pain.

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: No pain?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Your beauty is a gift to us.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Who deserves such a gift?

Speaker: mortal woman
Dialogue: No pain...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I've seen enough of this! I loathe it!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Be still!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Patience, Louis. Patience.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We've been searching for you for a very long time...

Speaker: estelle
Dialogue: Such a darling.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Monstrous.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Yes, and very beautiful.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Your lips, they didn't move.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: They did, but too fast for you to see them. No magic, just grace and speed.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: He wants you...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Disappointing, isn't it? To come so far and find so little. Jaded ingenues, amusing themselves with make- believe...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We had feared we were the only ones...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: But how did you come into existence?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: You don't want to answer... Two vampires from the new world, come to guide us into the new era as all we love slowly rots and fades away.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Are you the leader of this group?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: If there were a leader, I would be the one.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: So you have the answers...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Ah! You have questions?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What are we?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Nothing if not vampires...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Who made us what we are?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Surely you know the one who made you...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But the one who made him, who made the one who made him, the source of all this evil...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: That is a picture, nothing more.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You mean we are not children of Satan?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: I understand. I saw you in the theatre, your suffering, your sympathy for that girl. I saw you with the boy. You die when you kill, you feel you deserve to die and you stint on nothing. But does that make you evil? Or, since you comprehend what you call goodness, does it not make you good?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then there is nothing.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Perhaps...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: And perhaps this is the only real evil left...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then God does not exist...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: I have not spoken to him...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And no vampire here has discourse with God or the Devil?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: None that I've ever known. I know nothing of God or the Devil, I have never seen a vision nor learnt a secret that would damn or save my soul. And as far as I know, after four hundred years I am the oldest living vampire in the world.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: My God... So it's as I always feared. Nothing, leading to nothing.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: You fell too much. So much you make me feel...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: The one who made you should have told you this. The one who left the old world for the new...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He knew nothing. He just didn't care.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Knew? You mean he is...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Come, beloved. It's time we were on our way. I'm hungry and the city waits.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: So soon to go?

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: How did you wrong him?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You read my thoughts?

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: You said a name -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: A name I don't want to say again.

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: I seemed to recognize it...

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: There is but one crime among us vampires here.

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: You should know, who are so secretive about the vampire who made you.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Boredom!

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: It is the crime that means death to any vampire. To kill your own kind!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Aaaah! I was so afraid it was to be born like Venus out of the foam, as we were! Come Louis, let's go!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I loathe them! I can't stand the sight of them! Stupid bourgeois Parisians, all dressed in black like some private club! I've searched for them the world over and I despise them!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: What danger?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: I can feel it from them! They want to know who made us, what became of him. They have their rules, their idiotic rules!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Do you think I would let them harm you?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: No, you would not, Louis. Danger hold you to me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Love holds you to me. And we are in danger, not you.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Love?

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You would leave me for Armand if he beckoned you.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Never.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: He wants you as you want him. He's been waiting for you. He wants you for a companion. He bides his time that place. he finds them as dull and lifeless as we do.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: That's not so.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Do you know what his soul said to me without saying a word? When he put me in that trance...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: So you felt it too!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Let him go, he said. Let him go.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Is that what I should do Louis? Let you go? My father? My lover? My Louis, who made me?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: He can protect us, Claudia.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You really believe that?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: I was waiting for you...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Listen to me.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia is dear to me. My... daughter.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Your lover.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: No, my beloved, my child.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: If you say so. You are innocent.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I'm not innocent. But I'm afraid. She feels she's in danger from the others.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: She is.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: But why?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: I could give you reasons. Her silence. Her youth. It's forbidden to make so young, so helpless, that cannot survive on its own.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then blame the one who made her...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Did you kill this vampire who made you both? Is that why you won't say his name? Santiago thinks you did.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We want no quarrel with him.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: It's already begun. If you want to save her, send her away.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Then I leave too.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: So soon? Without any of those answers you so longed for?

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You said there were none.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: But you asked the wrong questions. Do you know how few vampires have the stamina for immortality? How quickly they perish of their own will.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: We can do that?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: You would never give up life. If the world were reduced to one empty cell, on fragile candle, you stay alive and study it. You see too clearly. You see too much.

Dialogue: That's what the one who made me said.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: How he must have loved you.

Dialogue: Louis, I need you more than he ever did. I need a link with this century. The world changes. We do not. Therein lies the irony that ultimately kills us. I need you to make contact with this age.

Dialogue: And the vampires of the Theatre?

Dialogue: Like moths around the candle of the age. Decadent, useless. They can't reflect anything. But you do. You reflect its broken heart.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Are these not the answers you came for?

Dialogue: Yes... My God...

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: A vampire with a human soul. An immortal with a mortal's passion. You are beautiful, my friend. Lestat must have wept when he made you -

Dialogue: Lestat! You knew Lestat!

Dialogue: Yes I knew him. Knew him well enough not to mourn his passing.

Dialogue: But you must go now. You must get her safely out of Paris.

Dialogue: No-one else knows of this door. When you knock you will find me waiting...

Dialogue: Madeleine... Louis is shy.

Dialogue: Drink.

Dialogue: You haven't the vaguest conception under God of what you ask!

Dialogue: Don't make me, Claudia! I cannot do it!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: You give her to me! Do this before you leave me!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Oh God! I love you still, that's the torment of it. But you know I must leave you Louis...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: And who will care for me my love, my dark angel, when you are gone?

Dialogue: You promise to care for her then?

Dialogue: Yes...

Dialogue: And you know what you ask for?

Speaker: madeleine
Dialogue: Yes.

Dialogue: What do you think she is, Madeleine? A doll?

Dialogue: A child who can't die...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: And the child who did die?

Speaker: madeleine
Dialogue: My daughter...

Speaker: louis

Speaker: madeleine
Dialogue: Yes!

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: Louis!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: She is dying. It happened to you too, but your child's mind can't remember.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: But if she dies...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: It's only mortal death.

Dialogue: Bear me no ill will, my love. We are now even.

Speaker: claudia
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Dialogue: Yes father. At last. We are een.

Dialogue: Looks up and screams.

Dialogue: Louis...

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: Is he the one?

Dialogue: No, the child. The child was the one...

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: All the murderers!!!

Dialogue: You are alive, Lestat! It can't be murder! Tell them how you treated us...

Dialogue: No... You come back to me Louis...

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Are you mad???

Dialogue: The sentence is death! To all of them!!!

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: Only the girl - it was the girl -

Dialogue: You promised me - I could take him back to New Orleans - Louis - there's something I must tell you - about that night - that night I met you -

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: You let her go, Lestat - you let her free - and I'll come back with you -

Speaker: santiago
Dialogue: Death for the others. For you eternity in a box -

Speaker: santiago

Speaker: lestat
Dialogue: He's coming home with me - you promised -

Dialogue: We promised nothing!

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Claudia!!!

Dialogue: Above him, reaching down to take his hand.

Dialogue: Hurry. Don't make a sound.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: Where is she? Where's Claudia?

Dialogue: Follow me - that way - through my cell -

Dialogue: Not without Claudia. Where is she?

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: I can't save her.

Dialogue: You can't believe I'd leave without her. Armand! You must save her! You have no choice.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Louis, I can't save her. I will only risk losing you -

Dialogue: You'll come home with me Louis? For a little while... until I am myself again.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: CLAUDIA!!!

Dialogue: I couldn't prevent it.

Speaker: louis
Dialogue: I don't believe you. I do not have to read your soul to know that you lie.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Louis, they cannot be brought back. There are some things that are impossible, even for me.

Dialogue: You let them do it.

Dialogue: You held sway over them. They feared you. You wanted it to happen.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Louis, I swear I did not.

Dialogue: I understand you only too well. You let them do it, as I let Lestat turn a child into a demon. As I let her rip Lestat's heart to pieces! Dialogue: You didn't even warm them, did you?

Dialogue: No.

Dialogue: I knew. I rescued you, didn't I? From the terrible dawn.

Dialogue: You were their leader. They trusted you.

Dialogue: You made me see their failings, Louis. You made me look at them with your eyes.

Speaker: armand
Dialogue: Your melancholy eyes...

Dialogue: What a pair we are. We deserve each other, don't we?

Dialogue: We are a pair, and that's what counts.

Dialogue: Looks around. Walks on. Sees another corpse, almost nothing but bones, sinking into the wet earth, the roots of an oak overgrowing it.  He looks up at the distant light. Dialogue: I'm so glad you're here Louis... I've dreamed of your coming...

Dialogue: Don't try to speak... it's alright...

Dialogue: I didn't mean to let them do it... that Santiago, he tricked me...

Dialogue: That's all past, Lestat.

Dialogue: Yes. Past... she should never have been one of us...

Dialogue: Still beautiful Louis. You always were the strong one.

Dialogue: Don't fear me, Lestat. I bring you no harm.

Dialogue: You've come back to me, Louis? You've come again to me?

Dialogue: It's only a siren...

Dialogue: And they frighten you?

Dialogue: It's false light, Lestat. It can't harm you...

Dialogue: If you stayed with me Louis, I could venture out... little by little... become the old Lestat.

Dialogue: I have to go now Lestat...

Dialogue: You remember how I was, Louis.. the vampire Lestat...

Dialogue: Yes. I remember...

Dialogue: I tried...

Dialogue: And the more you tried, the more I wanted you... a vampire with your beautiful, suffering human heart. And how you suffered... I need your forgiveness, Louis.

Dialogue: You have it...

Dialogue: You'll come back, Louis... take me out... little by little... and maybe I'll be myself again...

Dialogue: Yes, Lestat...

Dialogue: It's over, I'm telling you...

Dialogue: You need a new passion, Louis, a new reason to feel... what a story you've told, you don't understand yourself.

Dialogue: Do what you want with it. Learn what you can. Give the story to others.

Dialogue: You need me.

Dialogue: Dear God. I've failed again, haven't I?

Speaker: malloy
Dialogue: No...

Dialogue: You like it? You like being food for the immortals? You like dying? Is it beautiful? Is it intense?

Dialogue: No... please...

Dialogue: Thank God.

Dialogue: Louis... Louis...

Dialogue: Holy shit...

Dialogue: Jesus...
